alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeastern Massachusetts and northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, in southeastern Massachusetts, Bristol. In northern Rhode Island, Bristol, Kent and Providence. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Taunton, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Norton, Barrington and Swansea. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
